content: quote: Originally posted by SeaWitch1220: Did ANYONE actually read the linked article? I did. That is the problem with "gossip sources", THEY don't have to be accurate. To begin with, the article said "he wouldn’t let his family get on an airplane right now" and that is not correct. He said "I would tell members of my family - and I have - I wouldn't go anywhere in confined places now. It's not that it's going to Mexico but you're in a confined aircraft where one person sneezes it goes all the way through the aircraft..." He also said he would not suggest that they ride the subway. So now the question becomes, "did YOU click on the link within the article to hear what was actually said?" I heard it when he actually said it and this is just a recording of the statement. As the V.P. he is supposed to speak in an encouraging manner to the people, not discouraging manner. Especially with the economy so bad right now. He may be right, but it is not HIS place to make statements that are seen as discouraging to the people.
quote: Originally posted by SeaWitch1220: Did ANYONE actually read the linked article?
reply: I did. That is the problem with "gossip sources", THEY don't have to be accurate. He said "I would tell members of my family - and I have - I wouldn't go anywhere in confined places now. It's not that it's going to Mexico but you're in a confined aircraft where one person sneezes it goes all the way through the aircraft..." He also said he would not suggest that they ride the subway. So now the question becomes, "did YOU click on the link within the article to hear what was actually said?" I heard it when he actually said it and this is just a recording of the statement. content: quote: "Americans should heed the advice of medical experts when determining how best to manage health concerns during the ongoing swine flu outbreak. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and countless other experts, swine flu should not discourage people from traveling to or within the United States," Roger Dow, president and chief executive of the association, said in the statement. "Elected officials must strike a delicate balance of accurately and adequately informing citizens of health concerns without unduly discouraging travel and other important economic activity," he said. Lie to them as usual? Common sense tells me that I do not need to be around someone who is sick with a contagious disease, while in confined areas. Why do I need the CDC to tell me that? Do some folks think that the average person has no common sense?
quote: "Americans should heed the advice of medical experts when determining how best to manage health concerns during the ongoing swine flu outbreak. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and countless other experts, swine flu should not discourage people from traveling to or within the United States," Roger Dow, president and chief executive of the association, said in the statement. "Elected officials must strike a delicate balance of accurately and adequately informing citizens of health concerns without unduly discouraging travel and other important economic activity," he said. Lie to them as usual?
reply: Common sense tells me that I do not need to be around someone who is sick with a contagious disease, while in confined areas. Why do I need the CDC to tell me that? Do some folks think that the average person has no common sense?
title: At Least He Waited Until Day 101...

content: quote: Originally posted by SeaWitch1220: Did ANYONE actually read the linked article? I did. That is the problem with "gossip sources", THEY don't have to be accurate. To begin with, the article said "he wouldn’t let his family get on an airplane right now" and that is not correct. He said "I would tell members of my family - and I have - I wouldn't go anywhere in confined places now. It's not that it's going to Mexico but you're in a confined aircraft where one person sneezes it goes all the way through the aircraft..." He also said he would not suggest that they ride the subway. So now the question becomes, "did YOU click on the link within the article to hear what was actually said?" I heard it when he actually said it and this is just a recording of the statement. As the V.P. he is supposed to speak in an encouraging manner to the people, not discouraging manner. Especially with the economy so bad right now. He may be right, but it is not HIS place to make statements that are seen as discouraging to the people.

content: quote: "Americans should heed the advice of medical experts when determining how best to manage health concerns during the ongoing swine flu outbreak. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and countless other experts, swine flu should not discourage people from traveling to or within the United States," Roger Dow, president and chief executive of the association, said in the statement. "Elected officials must strike a delicate balance of accurately and adequately informing citizens of health concerns without unduly discouraging travel and other important economic activity," he said. Lie to them as usual? Common sense tells me that I do not need to be around someone who is sick with a contagious disease, while in confined areas. Why do I need the CDC to tell me that? Do some folks think that the average person has no common sense?
quote: "Americans should heed the advice of medical experts when determining how best to manage health concerns during the ongoing swine flu outbreak. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and countless other experts, swine flu should not discourage people from traveling to or within the United States," Roger Dow, president and chief executive of the association, said in the statement. "Elected officials must strike a delicate balance of accurately and adequately informing citizens of health concerns without unduly discouraging travel and other important economic activity," he said. Lie to them as usual?
reply: Common sense tells me that I do not need to be around someone who is sick with a contagious disease, while in confined areas. Why do I need the CDC to tell me that? Do some folks think that the average person has no common sense?
